resources.string: Import encrypted SQLITE DB\'s SK\'s signature
Export encrypted SQLITE DB\'s SK\'s signature
You need permission internet to run this application and to import data from cloud version! You also need permission foreground service to run server in background!
A-Jetty CA certificat ajetty-ca[A-Jetty#].peme and file exchanger public key ajetty-file-exch[A-Jetty#].kpub has been created.
Sending request to start server, please wait…
KS directory must contains only ks file!!!
New version of WEB static files has been copied!
Beige Accounting directory has been successfully created and WEB static files has been copied!

Beigesoft™ EIS stores your information in database files. Log files may also contain private information. This application is based on the built-in private A-Jetty Web server. This private Web Server is not accessible outside of your Android device. This application requires authorization with a strong password (you create a password yourself, and the software controls its reliability). This application allows 6 failed authorization attempts. Access will be blocked for 15 minutes in case of 6 unsuccessful login attempts. You need to periodically check the logSec.log file for authorization information. This application uses modern encryption of data passing from the server to the browser (HTTPS connection) and exchanged files (databases and log files). Your information (SQLite database), logStd.log, logSec.log, keystore are in the place that is inaccessible to other software. If you forget the keystore or the application password, then you will lose your information. Therefore, you need to periodically make a copy of the database into Google Drive. In addition, you can use encryption for the database, but this is appropriate when you send an encrypted database into Beigesoft™ EIS that is installed on a computer in protected from light harmful software way. This application has no direct access to your files on Google Drive, that is it can not list or read them. It only asks Google Drive Application for sending or receiving a file interactively, that is with user (your) confirmation. PDF reports will be downloaded into the Downloads shared folder, so avoid installing unnecessary applications that require access to the storage. When you connect your Android device to a computer in file sharing mode, then any application on the computer will have direct access to these files. You need to delete these PDF files from the shared storage after viewing them. When all Android applications will be forced to use "scoped storage", then they will have only interactive access to files in the Downloads folder. When your browser will pass a PDF file to a PDF viewer via the secure transport (not via shared Download folder), then all other applications will have no access to your PDF files. This application has neither direct nor interactive access to files on the shared storage. When you are going to send Log files to a third party (for example, to the programmer serving this software), then you need to delete all private information from these files. You also need to set a screen lock, such as a PIN code. You must accept this policy in order to work with this application.
